intro: Endiandra pubens var. typica, commonly known as the hairy endiandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, round drupe that contains a single seed.
